title: Domaine Houchart 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Owned by the Quiot family of Châteauneuf-du-Pape, this is one of a pair of wines produced from the region of Sainte-Victoire. It is a full and fruity wine, rich with raspberries and freshened by final grapefruit acidity.

title: Dürnberg 2015 Falkenstein Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: The inviting scent and flavour of green but ripe Conference pears sloshes joyously around the palate on this fruit-foward, easy and fluid wine. With its light but fruit-driven body it just seems to have been made for a summer party and spells easy joy and fun.

title: Dürnberg 2015 L&T Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: There is something delicate and almost floral about this slender, fresh Grüner. Tinged with pear drop, the light, easy-drinking palate is as soft as it is fresh but also reveals some peppery verve. Drink soon.

title: Hobo 2013 Branham Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: This is a bright, fresh and juicy version of the variety from a mountainous and indeed rocky appellation. A touch of leather rides over the proceedings, which consist mostly of red cherry, raspberry and cinnamon.

title: Los Portales 2013 Red (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Fresh, tangy red fruit flavors like raspberry and cherry are shaded by more mature, spicy and lightly oaky nuances that add some welcome complexity and the suggestion of sweetness. This wine was blended from 86% Zinfandel and 14% Syrah.

title: Luigi Bosca 2013 Finca la Linda Old Vines Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Floral, leathery aromas of cassis and raspberry are appealing and complete. This medium-weight Malbec is a touch jammy in feel as it delivers fresh, lightly herbal plum and raspberry flavors. On the finish, which is bright and agile, a minty flavor takes over.

title: Lyeth 2012 Chronology Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Crafted from a majority of Cabernet with smaller amounts of Malbec and Merlot, this county appellated wine is big in tannin and black fruit, with a weight of tar. Soft and integrated, especially toward the finish, it displays greener aspects of cedar as it goes.

title: Monte Faustino 2011  Recioto della Valpolicella Classico
description: Delicately scented, this opens with aromas of dried black cherry and toasted notes. On the concentrated palate, oak-driven spice takes center stage while mature dark-skinned fruit and dried prune provide the background. Pair it with Gorgonzola at the end of the meal.

title: Mt. Difficulty 2013 Bannockburn Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: Seemingly built with aging in mind, this wine shows a firm, drying edge to its tannins, particularly on the finish. For the present, dusty cherry fruit and mocha-brown sugar notes provide a refreshing dose of charm.

title: Ott & Murphy 2012 Boushey Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Coming from a vineyard best known for its Syrah, this wine intrigues with aromas of black pepper, wood spice, earth and dark fruit. The dark-fruit flavors bring a sense of depth and texture.

title: Pacific Rim 2014 Wallula Vineyard Dry Riesling (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Ripe apple, freshly cut pear and spice aromas lead to bone-dry fruit flavors with a tart finish. The concentration seems somewhat faint, but it brings a sense of elegance and balance, with a finish that persists.

title: Hunt Cellars 2011 Outlaw Ridge Destiny Vineyards Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Strawberry blossoms, candied cherries, cola and a touch of chipped slate make an appearance on the nose of this bottling. A cinnamon and clove spice component flavor the palate, where cooked black cherries, tart black plum peel, condensed lilac and cedar elements also show.

title: Muscardini 2013 Fortuna Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: This special blend combines 40% Zinfandel and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, with 10% each of Merlot and Syrah. Generous portions of fruity plum and blackberry mingle with sizable hits of vanilla and black pepper, girded in sturdy tannin and oak.

title: Fontanafredda 2015 Pradalupo  (Roero)
description: Delicately scented with a fragrance of spring wild flower and orchard fruit, this medium-bodied white delivers mature pear, yellow peach, citrus and a mineral note. Tangy acidity brightens the creamy flavors while a touch of hazelnut closes the finish.

title: Foxes Island 2014 Fox By John Belsham Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This is a fresh, fruit-driven rendering of Pinot Noir, marked by cherry-berry flavors and appealing hints of roses and salad greens. It's medium-bodied, with a silky texture that lingers on the finish.

title: Fabre en Provence 2015 Château de la Clapière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Pepper and spice come through strongly in this lemon and red-fruit-flavored wine. It has a creamy texture cut through with tangy orange and red currants. The aftertaste is full while always fruity.

title: Maison Nicolas Perrin 2014 Syrah (Vin de France)
description: There are edges of cocoa, pepper and curing spice to the dense red plum and cherry core of this attractive Syrah. Just a touch of gamy character throughout adds depth and intrigue. The rich fruit flavors continue on to the palate, with a texture like crushed satin and lingering notes of coffee, bittersweet chocolate and sweet spice.

title: Malavasi Daniele 2015  Lugana
description: Aromas of banana, yellow stone fruit and a heady whiff of jasmine jump out of the glass. The rounded palate offers peach, pink grapefruit and an herbal note alongside bright acidity.

title: Mar de Frades 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lemon and grapefruit aromas come with minerally notes of granite and crushed vitamin dust. An almost sharp and cutting palate offers generic citrus and green apple flavors in front of a chiseled, high-acid finish.

title: Mario Gagliasso 2011 Rocche dell'Annunziata  (Barolo)
description: Attractive aromas of rose, plum and blue flower float out of the glass. On the palate, vanilla, espresso and toasted oak overwhelm dried black cherry while astringent tannins leave a mouth-drying finish.

title: Mas de Cadenet 2015 Arbaude Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From a portion of the Mas de Cadenet vineyard that is in the Côtes de Provence appellation, this is the entry-level wine of the Negrel family's range. It is light, with raspberry fruit and bright acidity. This winning combination makes a delicious, refreshing apéritif style of wine.

title: Massucco 2015  Roero
description: Soft and juicy, this opens with a delicate fragrance of white spring blossom and an orchard in bloom. The soft, round palate offers white peach, citrus and a suggestion of pear. A hint of white almond closes the finish.

title: Francis Coppola 2013 Claret Diamond Collection Black Label Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Seriously tasty and full-bodied, this inky-colored wine is packed with ripe fruit, fine tannins and firm texture, and needs a juicy steak or tender roast as a table mate. A core of black cherry and black plum is shaded by spicy oak.

title: Charmed 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (California)
description: Pink with the slightest touch of yellow and orange on the edges, this wine offers very even aromas on the nose of ripe strawberry, raspberry, nectarine, melon and orange on the nose. The palate is round with bubble gum, light strawberry and peach flavors, epitomizing the crisp while lush style of rosé that's preferred by the masses these days.

title: Las Positas 2012 Coccineous Estate Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Flavorful, easy to drink and lively in texture, this wine is a blend of Tempranillo, Petite Sirah, Syrah and Malbec that will be a crowd-pleaser. It has juicy flavors like dark cherry and raspberry, a moderate amount of fine tannin for mouthfeel and a clean fruity finish.

title: Michel Gassier 2015 Les Piliers Viognier (Vin de France)
description: This wine's lively bouquet leads with pretty aromas of peach, nectarine, orange blossom and ginger. The fruity palate is supported by pineapple-tinged acidity and a refreshing orange-spiked spice that lingers through the close. Easy drinking and well balanced, enjoy this white now.

title: Krutz 2012 Magnolia Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Leathery, meaty and thick, this wine has reasonable oak and a note of coconut flakes coming off the nose to suggest perhaps American oak. A thick texture is adorned in cedar and currant, with a sticky, grippy sense of tannin that mellows in time.

title: Lafond 2014 SRH Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Yellow apples, slightly dried jasmine, buttered lemons and a touch of banana show on the nose of this bottling from pioneer Pierre Lafond's upper tier winery. The acidity is very tactile on the otherwise rich sip, with slightly sour apple and poached pear notes, squeezed lime and a vanilla-apple ripeness.

title: Nicholson Ranch 2013 Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a classically styled white, light and chiseled in acidity with highlights of golden apple and caramel. From the estate at the entrance into Carneros, it's a nice wine for the table.

title: Occasio 2015 Del Arroyo Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Livermore Valley)
description: Taking a whiff of this wine is like walking into a florist's shop. The aromas are roses and magnolias, and the flavors are like ripe white peach and crisp apple. For all that dreamy floral character, however, this light-bodied wine is only slightly sweet, and has good crisp acidity for balance.
